revised_title: Mineralogy and Petrology of Luna 24 Core Fragments
tldr: The study examines the mineralogy and petrology of rock fragments and fine fractions from the Luna 24 core, a regolith sample collected from Mare Crisium on the Moon. The majority of the minerals analyzed are derived from basaltic rocks native to Mare Crisium, with a small proportion of highland material present as glass fragments in the fine fractions. The findings provide insights into the composition and origin of lunar regolith material.
